Half-Life 2 is a real gem of a game. An overall fun experience. I can't say it's something for everyone but it's certainly an experience that is enjoyable. I enjoyed almost every minute of the game.

So don't buy it. Valve doesn't deserve your money. Valve has put this game off for 10 fucking years and continue to vacuum in cash. They let other companies and machines do the work while they get paid in billions. They can't even give their fucking fanbase some closure after waiting 10 years for a third game or atleast some form of "this is how it ends." No, what happens is retired writer for the series, Marc Laidlaw has to go tell us how it ends while also throwing in some subtle "anger" at valve.

One of the WORST games I have ever played. No not even that. THE worst game I have ever played. And I've played many games, not just on steam. There is almost no story whatsoever (It's not that I don't understand stories, I've played Bioshock Infinite, trust me). I don't know if this is because I didn't play the first Half-Life, but one should be able to understand the story without playing all the games. I keep playing the game hoping to come across something good (Everyone is always talking about how good Half-Life 2 is), but I've finally given up and decided to not play the game. I feel relieved every time I stop playing this game, and a game shouldn't make you feel that. The graphics and audio are also terrible, and I'm fine with that, since it's an old game and I usually don't pay much mind to graphics as long as the game is decent. But this game is absolutely horrific. Do yourself a favor and DON'T BUY THIS GAME!

Half-Life 2 is one of the best games ever. What Valve did with HL2 was to create a masterpiece that revolutionized an industry and influenced the games that came later, becoming a pop culture object.
In Half-Life 2 they control Gordon Freeman, the scientist who survived the incident in Black Mesa, which arrives in City 17, a city controlled by Combine, an alien race that established an authoritarian regime in the city. Gordon is soon engaging in the struggle between a human strength and a Combine and a roller coaster of events that follow in one of the most memorable histories ever.
Half-Life 2 was developed for gaming and accounting. There are no cutscenes, a story unfolds around the protagonist and retains control over a character throughout the game.
It features memorable characters such as Alyx Vance, Barney, Dr Kleiner and of course the mysterious G-Man.
Visually the game is amazing. The game engine Fonte manages to create some of the most amazing animations and environments ever seen and a physics of objects corresponding to real life. The gameplay is fluid, and there are several weapons to use, with clear highlight for a Gravity Gun that allow manipulating objects or use them as projectiles. In certain sections there are vehicles to control, which varies the gameplay and there are also some puzzles that use the physics engine itself to the resolver during the advance in the game.
The AI ​​of the enemies is also excellent, they look for cover and prcuram flanquear the player, except for the zombies that like any zombie that prears so advances towards the player to kill it.
In short, Half-Life 2 is a milestone in the video game industry and a must-have for anyone considering a gamer.

10/10
真的是非常经典的作品。虽然比较“古老”，无论画质还是效果在现在看来都比较不足，但却能使人产生身临其境的感觉。情节，动作，音乐的搭配完美，且每一个细节都能看出制作的用心。游戏剧情连贯，紧张，刺激，对玩家有相当大的吸引力。不过剧情又太过紧张，没做到张弛有度。如果不是死忠粉，无时无刻的战斗会使玩家疲劳，不利于持续游戏。————————我当然要推荐这款游戏

Half-Life 2 is widely regarded as one of the best games of all time, and for its time, I must admit it's really something. But as an avid fan of the first Half-Life (I have stopped counting how many times I have beaten that game but I'm certain it's like at least 30), I can't get over just how poor of a followup it is now that its technical prowess is no longer the mind boggling, video card melting beast it was in 2004. 

Compared to Half-Life, the shooting is worse, the enemies are significantly dumber and much less interesting, the setting is far less interesting... I could go on. The weirdest aspect of it all to me is just how poor of a sequel (jn the narrative sense) it really is to the first game. A semi-experienced modder could probably mod out every reference to HL1 in a day and the actual story really wouldn't change. They should've called it something else.

A very fun FPS that managed to stay fresh through the 14 hours that took me to finish it. Very challenging and not too frustrating. This game has aged extremely well, except for the physics, kinda.

The only thing that I really disliked were the striders. Those things don't miss a single damn shot. Also the chapter Santraps wasn't very fun because you need to use various props to go through certain parts, and because of the old physics, the movement is very clunky when you stand on the props. Though they made up for this in the chapter Our Benefactors. You'll know what I'm talking about when you play this game.

Definitely buy.

TL;DR: this game might've been a landmark in gaming 13 years ago, but a lot has happened in 13 years and HL2 is showing some serious crow's feet.



I had heard this game was supposed to rival the second coming of christ in terms of quality, so i picked it up on sale.
For anyone who hasn't played this game yet, it's honestly not worth getting at full price. sure it showcases a physics engine and looks and animates great for a 2004 game, but it's not 2004 anymore.

Storywise, it's nothing special. some foreign militant force has taken over earth, you get picked up and taken into a resistance force but there's a traitor working for the enemy among you, you rescue somebody important to the resistance from jail, and then you return to destroy the enemy's big doom tower. It's not awful but it's certainly not the heartrending masterpiece i was lead to believe it was.

The gameplay doesn't make up for it either. Combat doesn't evolve at all beyond "shoot a gun at a man", which can work for games with different enemy types or fast-paced gameplay, but every enemy in the game is just a slight variation of a man with a full-head helmet and hitscan weapons.
While there are quite a few weapons on display, none of them feel great to use. the two automatic weapons you get are wildly inaccurate beyond 20 metres and do a pathetic amount of damage, the crossbow and magnum are decent long-range high-damage weapons but you never get ammo for them so you'll rarely use them, the grenades don't go where you aim them so trying to bounce them off a windowsill to kill someone in cover is needlessly complicated, and the rocket launcher is only slightly more effective against vehicles than blowing kisses. Possibly the only decent weapon is the shotgun, which has just enough range to almost make the SMG obsolete and enough damage with the secondary fire to kill most enemies with a single headshot. There's also gun that you can use to toss loose physics objects at things but that's only really particularly useful in one level where the game basically decorates the walls with sawblades and explosive barrels.

The level design seems intent on showcasing the game's physics engine, and it gets old fast. Often you'll have to stop some high-octane action to solve a physics puzzle, using the word "puzzle" as loosely as possible.  9 times out of 10 it just involves putting a physics object somewhere either as a platform or as a weight, or using the above mentioned gravity gun to move a bunch of heavy objects out of your path. sometimes the levels can be big and sprawling but they're more often than not entirely linear with little side areas that might hold a few supply crates.

As an aside: for a game all about its physics engine it has some of the most mediocre vehicle physics i've ever seen. A high-powered assault buggy handles like a homemade go-cart powered by an electric toothbrush motor and a fanboat seems to handle almost exactly the same over water. It's not the tech limitations either; halo came out in 2001 and made its jeep feel like a real car. I'm pretty sure it even lost traction on icy surfaces. beyond good and evil came out in 2003 and had a water vehicle that actually felt like it was going through water. both of these games had plenty of other content on top of vehicle sections that didn't control like an RC car on low battery.

What finally got me to give a negative review was a bug in the second last level where the game relied on a scripted event to blow up a wall to let me progress, but it never happened. I spent half an hour shooting the infinitely respawning enemies (which hadn't occurred up until that point - if you killed all the enemies in an area they were gone for good) and dying over and over again looking for the way forward. After checking a walkthrough and seeing that an event wasn't triggering i had a look for solutions, where i was told to restart the level and hope the event worked this time. Given the level was if not the longest then certainly the most tedious thus far, i decided i had played enough. 

If you want a decent shooter made by valve, get team fortress or counter strike. If you want a good puzzle game from valve, get portal. If you want a shooter with a good story, get spec ops. This game does all three fairly blandly and i can't recommend it unless your PC can't run anything else.
